app.loginOutContent: Confirm to log out of current account?
app.name: Name
app.backfillipsConfirm:
Backfill IPs can be used to add/remove IPs from nodes
based on the current configuration of Headscale.

If there are nodes that does not have IPv4 or IPv6
even if prefixes for both are configured in the config,
this command can be used to assign IPs of the sort to
all nodes that are missing.

If you remove IPv4 or IPv6 prefixes from the config,
it can be run to remove the IPs that should no longer
be assigned to nodes. 
 Are you sure that you want to assign/remove IPs to/from nodes?
app.qr: show QR code for login URLs (default false)
app.rest: reset unspecified settings to their default values (default false)
app.operator: Unix username to allow to operate on tailscaled without sudo
app.ssh: run an SSH server, permitting access per tailnet admin's declared policy (default false)
app.authKey: node authorization key; if it begins with "file:", then it's a path to a file containing the authkey
app.hostname: hostname to use instead of the one provided by the OS
app.timeout: maximum amount of time to wait for tailscaled to enter a Running state; default (0s) blocks forever (default 0s)
app.acceptDns: accept DNS configuration from the admin panel (default true)
app.acceptRisk: accept risk and skip confirmation for risk types: lose-ssh,all
app.acceptRoutes: accept routes advertised by other Tailscale nodes (default true)
app.exitNode: Tailscale exit node (IP or base name) for internet traffic, or empty string to not use an exit node
app.advertiseConnector: advertise this node as an app connector (default false)
app.advertiseExitNode: offer to be an exit node for internet traffic for the tailnet (default false)
app.exitNodeAllowLanAccess: Allow direct access to the local network when routing traffic via an exit node (default false)
app.advertiseTags: comma-separated ACL tags to request; each must start with "tag:" (e.g. "tag:eng,tag:montreal,tag:ssh")
app.advertiseRoutes: routes to advertise to other nodes (comma-separated, e.g. "10.0.0.0/8,192.168.0.0/24") or empty string to not advertise routes

http.501: Server not implemented the requested functionality
http.505: HTTP version not supported for this request
